inn1.comm: back of a length on off stump, Hash is able to blunt it at his feet

howzzat? the shortish delivery jerks back at Amla, who was looking to back his hands and bat away. But the ball jumps off his arm guard and elbow over to the second slip. Australia do well not to review
back of a length on off stump, defended stoutly

Amla relishes the sight of a fuller ball, and it seems quite happy to see Amla too judging by the amount of width on it. Hit through the line, without too much footwork, and yet it races away past mid-off's left
good length ball outside off, allowed through to the keeper
not there! Can't bowl full and straight to Amla who pulls out those sublime wrists and sends the ball scuttling away through midwicket

beaut! This was at 143 kph from Starc and de Kock was nowhewre near ready for it. Suddenly realises a yorker is threatening his off stump and just about manages an inside edge to the fine leg boundary. Verrrry lucky
good length ball on off stump, carefully defended
fuller and drew him to play away from the body as de Kock tries to push into the covers. Closes the face as he checks his stroke

another inside edge as Starc manages a bit of awayswing at 144 kph. De Kock provides gap between bat and pad as he looks to drive on the up. Should get that front foot across a bit more if he wants to time that shot
oh, that's wawyard. After a string of good balls he seeks even more pace, and succeeds in getting it. This was at 146 kph, but slides down leg
another ball slipping down leg, 142 kph fuller ball evades de Kock's flick

third inside edge of the over as de Kock goes forward to a back of a length delivery. He's realised the mistake though as he pulls his bottom hand away and ensures the ball goes to ground to square leg
width outside off at 145 kph, de Kock looks to hammer it away through the off side but misses. That was there to be hit, but he's just not quite comfortable at the crease yet
Australia have a wonderful crop of quicks! Hazlewood shows off his ability to straighten a good length ball outside off and beats Hash
that's a top leave. Shuffled across to a good length ball to protect his off stump, judged that this wasn't coming back in and once it was outside his eyeline, he shouldered arms
good length ball a shade outside off, Amla gets in line with it and blocks
back of a length and outside off, Amla is happy to let it go through to the keeper
fuller delivery that straightens on off stump, Amla checks his push into the covers
back of a length and way outside off stump to tempt Hash into playing when the ball is swinging
straying on the pads and de Kock looks better as he waits on the ball and tucks to square leg
got into the drive a little too soon that time as Starc bowls a good length ball outside off and pulls off his bottom hand again
looks to glance it fine, but the hint of inswing goes past the closed face and kisses the thigh pad and lets him get a couple
still struggling with his feet, but he usually has pretty decent hand-eye. Manages to block a shortish delivery on off stump
yorker first up, bouncer now! Starc's generating some serious pace here - 145 kph snorter on middle and leg stump that forces de Kock to bend away like a gymnast! Excellent leave, excellent delivery
back of a length on the stumps, defended
jumps back to a ball just back of a length and tucks it away through midwicket
good length ball on off stump, defended

that's well done. Should get him going as he manages to time a punch down the ground well enough for the SCG outfield to take over. It was a good length ball outside off and de Kock has moved forward a little better this time
shortish on off stump, defended
down the track, but he has tried to hit a shortish ball angled across him a little too hard. Gets a bottom edge that goes towards the covers

oh yeah! That's what he was trying to do the last ball, but the length wasn't there. This time it was right in the slot, or he made it so by charging down the track. And then a full swing of the arms belts a length ball down to the long-off boundary
full and wide, might be a little too much. Ah, not quite. Managed to skirt inside the tram line as Amla leaves
shortish delivery on the pads, Amla flicks it away to fine leg
full and curling back in, de Kock accounts for it with a closed face and pushes to mid-on
shortish with just enough room for de Kock to ride the bounce down to third man. Nice little steer
back of a length and outside off, left alone
banged in short on middle and leg, but Hash has spotted it early and ducks
beats de Kock with a shortish delivery that nips away with the angle across the left-hander.

goes short again, but this time he has strayed on middle and leg and de Kock has hammered a pull to the square leg boundary. Simply done, although when a batsman is not quite moving forward, that's the kind of balls he wants
back of a length on off stump, defended
full and a little too wide outside off, de Kock is happy to collect the extra
shortish and on the pads, de Kock gets inside the line in hopes of tickling that fine. Gets it off the thigh pad in front of square leg
not quite short enough for the pull and the 137 kph delivery angled across whistles away underneath the bat
too full and de Kock has unleashed some top class wristwork to power it away to the midwicket boundary. Looked like watching Amla through a mirror!
starts off with a bit of a half-volley that Amla drives to mid-off
not enough pace to be trying that sort of bowling. It was 126 kph and very short and wide, Amla shifts his weight back and pulls well in front of square
fuller ball on off stump, tapped away to mid-on's right for a single
employs a closed face to work a back of a length delivery from outside off towards midwicket

the slower pace almost works in his favour now. Amla's been peppered with 140kph deliveries all morning, but this one is 131 and on a good length. Looks to flick it away through midwicket again but gets a leading edge and it was uppish too. But there was no one close enough in the covers
back of a length on off stump, pushed down to mid-off
shortish and a shade outside off, de Kock is comfortable at that length and blocks
shortish on middle and de Kock taps it short midwicket
a little too leg-sidish and de Kock lets it come on, rolls his wrists and picks up a single to deep square leg
stands up tall to punch a shortish delivery through the covers, but a little bit of seam away beats the outside edge
you can pack the point field, but it it is that short and that wide, Amla is going to slap it away to the boundary 10 out of 10 times. Maxi was in close, Smith was deeper and finer. Bisected them
shortish and a little closer to off stump, punched away to point
looks to use his feet, but Faulkner pulls his length back on off stump and slows down his pace. Defended
fuller and outside off, de Kock's lack of footwork helps this time as he stands and delivers a thump to short cover
comes down again as Faulkner bowls a lot shorter and forces the batsman to chop into the covers. And the bowler has overstepped. Free Hit time
length ball on off stump, but it was slower - 112 kph. Foils de Kock's timing on the slog and it wanders away to mid-on
that front foot goes right across outside off, the back foot follows and he has picked a length ball, that would have been hit through the covers, away to the fine leg boundary
goes across on off stump again as he looks to nudge through midwicket, but he has played too early and the closed face offers up a leading edge that falls just short of short cover
shortish on middle and off, nudged away towards midwicket
flighted on middle and leg, worked away through square leg
tossed up and drifting away outside off, Amla slices it away to deep cover
good length ball, a little quicker too on off stump. defended
teases him with flight and de Kock drives through the covers, along the ground though
beaten as he tries to cut a good length ball that goes on with the angle. Too full to do that

gone! Maxi's done it as he lures Amla to nick off! This was a fuller delivery drifting further and further away from him, but is tempted by the gap at midwicket. Closes the face in hopes of picking it, but ends up edging to the keeper. Wade pulls off a pretty good take there
back of a length ball on off stump, defended
fuller delivery on off stump, de Kock punches to mid-off
banged in short, a little too short to elicit a shot from the batsman
that's a bottom edge as de Kock looks to flay a short ball outside off through point, but settles for a four to third man. Wade does his best to move to his left and then dive, but it was past him
fuller delivery outside off, de Kock drives to mid-off

that's a top shot! Especially when he hasn't quite been timing the ball because he wasn't waiting for the ball properly. This short ball comes in with a bit of room, he delays the cut shot just long enough to pick the gap behind point. Good hands
short on middle and leg, pulled away to deep square leg
looped in on middle, Rossouw keeps it out
drilled to short cover as this is a tossed up delivery just outside off
goes full and a shade outside off again, punched away to short cover again
strays a little on leg stump, nudged behind square leg
loads of flight outside off, De Kock slices it through the covers for a couple

sliding on with the arm again and Rossouw plays for turn as he lunges forward to block outside the line. Gets hit on the front pad on the move, but it would have slid down leg. And an inside edge to boot
shortish on middle and off, de Kock works it away through midwicket
good length ball on middle, Rossouw keeps it out carefully and asks the sightscreen to be moved to the right a little more from where he stands
shortish on leg stump, tucked to midwicket
too short and too straight, Rossouw jumps across and pulls down and to deep fine leg
shortish on middle and leg stump, defended
worked away off his hips to deep square leg
tossed up just a shade outside off, Rossouw is happy to leave it alone. Brave decision with Maxi not turning the ball so much as sliding it on
good length ball on off stump, defended
flighted on off stump, pushes forward to block
chance, but it lobs over mid-on! It was Hazlewood there who can't get the jumping jacks working properly. Rossouw getes a first boundary as he swipes at a flighted delivery well outside off
flighted outside off, pushed down to long-off for an easy single
shot! That's the best that has been played all day as de Kock finally moves properly forward and drills a length ball through the gap at extra cover.
banged in short on middle and leg, pulled away to deep fine leg
goes short and it's got a little too much height on it, conveys the square leg umpire to the one at the bowler's end
shortish on leg stump, worked away behind square with a roll of the wrists
banged in short on middle and leg, de Kock goes for a pull but Cummins manages to get enough height behind this one on middle and off
back of a length on off stump, de Kock is looking to work it through midwicket. Gets an inside edge onto pad
chops a back of a length delivery behind square on the off side. Point scampers in, but Rossouw has judged a very good single and makes it with a slide
flighted just outside off, De Kock slices it away to short cover. Wade chimes in with, "oh, that's so close to a nick!"
fifty for de Kock, his first against Australia. And he usually converts from this point. Taps a shortish delivery outside off between point and cover
tossed up on off stump, pushed back at the bowler
slower through the air and he gets a little drift away from the bat. Rossouw covers it and pushes through to the sweeper
stays back to a length ball and hopes it cut it behind point, but Pat Cummins rushes to his right and dives to stop any runs
sliding on with the arm as de Kock goes back to work it away. Doesn't succeed
good length ball on off stump, Rossouw pushes to short cover
full and wide, Rossouw moves across and laces it in front of point. Lovely timing and he found the gap perfectly as well
length ball a shade outside off, defended stoutly
gets across on off stump and then leaves a shortish delviery outside off

fuller delivery, tailing in just a touch. But Rossouw has stayed still enough at the crease and drills it through extra cover. Strong bottom hand and the merits of playing late as he shovels an almost yorker through to the boundary
predictable response from a big fast bowler and Rossouw was on his haunches almost as the ball pitched short on and around off stump. Seems to be drinks...
tossed up outside off, driven down to long-off
flighted on off stump, watchfully defended
goes back and flicks a length ball that was sliding down towards mid-on
tossed up on middle and leg, de Kock stays inside the line and pushes to long-off
goes back and tucks a quicker, flatter delivery through midwicket
this time he flights the ball, and reduces his pace on middle. De Kock blocks
fuller ball on off stump, drilled back at the bowler. Lovely straight blade coming down through the line the ball there
back of a length and outside off, looks to tuck it away through midwicket with a closed face, but gets an inside edge onto pad
shortish and outside off, tapped to short cover
just a bit short of a good length on off stump, Rossouw pushes it back at the bowler
this good length ball seems to stop on the pitch as Roussouw has to check his push into the covers. had set up for the shot a little too early
punched down to long-off for an easy single
flighted on off stump as Rossouw gets forward and nudges it away through midwicket
strays on the pads, but de Kock is not able to tickle the ball past short fine leg
tossed up on off stump, defended
gets down the track, but Maxi has adjusted his flight and bowls flatter. Worked away through midwicket
nudged away to the right of short fine leg. This was always going to be an important partnership for South Africa and it seems to be flourishing
gets down the track and pushes a good length ball into the covers
shuffles back and across to work a good length ball from off stump to deep square leg
back of a length and a shade outside off, de Kock lets it come on and rides it into the covers for a single
banged in quite short and outside off stump, not bothered with
eases a fuller ball outside off through point. His strokeplay is becoming more fluent now

well done, stumps at the bowler's end! This was a length ball that Rossouw had crunched off the back foot. Faulkner attempted to get a hand in between but the ball had gone past him before he could think about it.
tossed up on middle and off stump, defended
nudged away off his back foot through square leg
tossed up outside off, driven through to long-off
flighted on leg stump, de Kock works it through the vacant square leg region as Steven Smith seems to be warming up
tossed up outside off, Rossouw opens the face and picks the gap in the covers to pick up a couple
heeeeeave ho! This has been crashed to cow corner as de Kock lines up a shortish delivery and launches it. Front-foot swipe perfectly nailed
good length ball on middle and leg, worked away through square leg and looks for a couple. Only problem is David Warner was prowling in that area and it is never wise to take on his arm
banged in short again and Rossouw has rocked back and pulls to the square leg boundary. Not enough pace behind it for the length it was bowled at
good length ball on middle and off, Rossouw stays back and looks to run it down to third man. Doesn't quite succeed
that's a slower ball, possibly off the back of the hand. Rossouw has spotted it and nudged it down to mid-on and has snagged a quick single
another slower ball that drifts in on middle, and hits the blockhole as well. Pushed to long-off
runs down the track, but the bowler bowls short to try and one-up de Kock. Slapped away to deep point
shortish on middle, Rossouw gets some wrists into play but finds midwicket
goes short and Rossouw has to get up on his toes to pull this from outside off to deep square leg. Slips as he sets off for a run

rides the angle across him and de Kock finds a smart boundary to third man. Hazlewood isn't pleased, and seems to want that fielder finer. Lovely touch from the batsman though, can't take anything off the stroke
should have tried to same shot here, but he prefers to get across and pull and again the shortish ball ducks under the pull
tucked away off his hips to deep square leg
tossed up on middle with some drift away as well. Surprises de Kock with it as he blocks with a straighter face than he had intended when he saw the ball looped up his eyeline
worked away with the turn through square leg
goes back to a length ball and punches it down to long-off
loads of flight on this and it ends up a full toss on off stump, de Kock bunts it down to long-on
goes back to a length ball but is cramped for room. Nudged to midwicket
flighted on middle, defended. End of a pretty good first over, considering Smith is a part-timer
runs a shortish ball down to third man, another example of him waiting on the ball and playing as late as he could
full and on the pads, Rossouw clips it away to deep midwicket
goes short and outside off, de Kock pulls to deep midwicket for another single
slapped away to deep cover as this is a back of a length ball angled across him. Wonder if there's merit to picking up the powerplay now...
that's the change of pace as de Kock pushes to short cover

runs down the track and looks to take advantage of the room offered on a length ball outside off. Only he had made a little too much room for himself in that endeavour and has to stretch out to reach it. Gets a thick outside edge that falls a few yards short of deep third man
gets across to a length ball on middle and works it away to the right of short fine leg
tossed up on middle, Rossouw gets forward and nudges into the midwicket region
shortish and outside off, punched to short cover off the back foot
tossed up on middle, de Kock ventures down the pitch and pushes to long-on
oopsy! Gets a knock on his grille as he looks for a lap sweep off a fuller delivery on middle. Ball comes right off the face and thuds into the helmet
"catch," someone yells as Rossouw belts a full toss to deep midwicket. The call wasn't too far off the mark, actually. Falls short of the fielder
back of a length on off stump, he opens the face to try and pick the gap past short cover but finds the man
shortish on off stump, blocked into the off side
shortish on off stump, he shuffles across and works the ball away to deep square leg

that's a slower bouncer and it's perfectly directed. Rolls his fingers down on it and gets it to bounce quite awkwardly. De Kock is caught in the crease as he tries to get up tall enough to ride it away towards third man
banged in quick and short, but Rossouw is happy to rock back and hammer it to the square leg boundary. Vicious pull
gets in line with a back of a length delivery and pushes it to long-off
looks to upset the bowler as he threatens him with a sweep, ends up being a double bluff that Smith doesn't fall for. Good length ball pushed to the off side
good length ball, defended

they go up, and so does the umpire's finger. But Rossouw reviews. This was tossed up. This was tossed up on middle and leg and the batsman went down for a reverse sweep and seems to have hit it off the arm and then caught by the keeper running forward. Would have missed leg stump on the lbw as well
flighted outside off and it's been driven to long-off
pushed back down the ground to mid-on
that's the slower ball, shortish and outside off. Slapped away to point with the field up
drilled into the covers to pick up a single off a shortish ball angled across him
another shortish and slower delivery outside off, pulled to deep square leg
full and wide outside off, de Kock has sliced it away to deep cover. Didn't try to overhit and therefore he timed it very well. Hundred stand between these two
punched to mid-off as this length ball was a shade outside off
full and a bit too wide outside off, Rossouw leaves and collects the extra

slower short ball on middle and leg, Rossouw swivels on his back foot for a pull and short fine leg had gone a little too far to his right. Sticks out his hands in the other direction and manages to stop it just in time
length ball outside off, de Kock looks to smash it through the off side. Cut off at short cover
nudged away through midwicket as this is fuller on middle and leg
there's that slipper yorker from Starc again. Followed de Kock who was making room outside leg stump and sneaked through between bat and pad
short and wide. Slashed through point, but there is protection.
driven strongly through the extra cover region as Rossouw brings up his first ODI fifty
short on middle and leg, pulled down and to the man at deep square leg

and Rossouw cannot capitalise! It was back of a length and outside off, he was looking to baseball-whack it into the leg side. Gets it off the bottom of the blade to present a simple catch to mid-on. One of the first false strokes he has played today, was it because of the powerplay?
width on offer and de Kock slices it away to deep point
good length ball outside off, given passage to the keeper
fullish and a little too straight as well, Faf clips it away to deep square leg rather nicely and the skies have opened up all of a sudden!

first ball after the break and Faf's gone! It was a slower ball just outside off length, Faf pushed the ball back, but played early and had to check it in the end, the ball went slow and lobbed towards mid off where Bailey had to dive low and in front to his right for a good catch
fullish outside off on length, pushed to cover
shortish on middle and off, tucked to short midwicket
back of a length on of stump, de Kock taps to short midwicket
but neither are in business as Starc slides a length ball down the leg side
back-to-back then, and Starc checks on the bowling crease. This was shortish and angled down, de Kock's flick doesn't connect again
back of a length and outside off, de Kock gets a bottom edge as he looks for a chop through point
sends down a bouncer only a shade outside off, de Kock is happy to stay inside the line and sway away
slapped away to the sweeper as he gets forward to a shortish ball with enough width

catch is the cry, but the top edge does not carry to deep midwicket! Goes into the pull with his balance all wrong. It was climbing on him, cramping him for room and he was on the front foot as well. Not the best place to pull a ball that was coming at his chest
clipped away off his thighs to deep square leg
gets across in front of all three stumps and tries to flick a back of a length delivery away behind square leg. Gets hit rather high on the pads which means there's no hope for the leg before shout
he's been equally good and bad on the pull today. This was a shortish ball slanted across him but de Kock looks to drag it into the leg side and fails.
wanders well across off stump to help a length ball away to the fine leg boundary, but only ends up inside edging it onto his knee

finally, and he's timed it as well as could be. Perhaps a little shorter than the bowler would have liked and it sat up for de Kock who was running away outside off again and short-arm pulls it to the fine leg boundary. Into the nineties, then
pins him to his crease, but Miller prefers it that way as he runs a shortish ball down towards third man
lovely drive through the covers, although the bowler did pitch it a little too full and offered enough room for de Kock to lean into it
back of the hand slower ball as de Kock backs away and cuts behind point.... well enough to beat Finch on the boundary! Well played!
good length ball on off stump, he had set up for a swipe into the leg side but checks himself just in time and defends
fullish on off stump, de Kock pushes down to long-off
fuller delivery on off stump, Miller works it to the right of short midwicket, who can only parry it to mid-on
good length ball on off stump, defended to short cover
shortish on middle, Miller is cramped but tucks it away to the left of mid-on
good ploy! With the batsman nearing a milestone, an anxious one at that Hazlewood sneaks in a bouncer just outside off. De Kock thought about an upper cut, but doesn't quite go through with it
back of a length on off stump and he taps it in front of point for a quick single. Lovely work
a little shape back in at Miller and it happens late enough to stifle the batsman's flick. Gets an inside edge onto his pad

neatly struck as he drives a fuller delivery into short cover! Why are they going for a single there?! Steve Smith is the man who runs across to his right and has a shy, but misses! de Kock, on 98, had given up!
a little bit of turn off a good length, Miller misses a flick but manages a little deflection off the thigh pad towards fine leg
looped up outside off and Miller shovel-drives it to cover
good length ball, a little quicker on off stump. Tapped into the off side

down the throat of deep fine leg! He's out off a full toss, would you believe it? Goes into a sweep way too early, gets a top edge that is easily pouched by Cummins. South Africa are slipping now, that powerplay has thrown their innings out of balance
rocks back to a shortish delivery outside off and cracks it to cover. Can't hit the gap
flighted on the pads and worked away to square leg
tossed up on off stump, pushed back at the bowler. Wade yells, "hit him on the pad!"
tossed up on off stump, Behardien pushes to mid-off and runs! Another risky single, but it's well taken as the throw at the non-strikers' end goes awry
flighted outside off, de Kock opens the face and drives through the covers to move on to 99
flighted outside off and he drives to mid-off's left

and there's his sixth ODI ton! Pulls off his helmet and acknowledges his team-mates in the dressing room and then to the crowd. Good length ball tucked away in front of square leg to bring up his first hundred in Australian shores, and the first by a South African at the SCG in 50-over cricket
flighted on off stump, drilled down to long-on
teasing outside off, but Behardien is happy to push it along the ground to mid-off. That's the kind of ball that you itch to lift over the off side
tossed up outside off, de Kock drives to long-off as well
drags it short and Behardien is foiled by his own intent. Sought to hit the ball much too hard and mistimes it though midwicket. "Oh my Goodness," yells Wade
tossed up a shade outside off as de Kock defends with an open face.
pushed through quicker and flatter outside off, but de Kock likes it. The extra pace, the shorter length makes him jump back deep in his crease and cut away behind point
tossed up and taken on the full toss on middle as de kock pushes down the ground
goes short first up and de Kock pulls to deep midwicket
full and outside off, Behardien has drilled it through the covers. Beautiful timing, that's the kind of shot that sets up a batsman's innings. Helpful half-volley outside off, easily put away
looks decent off the back foot too as he punches a shortish ball to point. Important innings for Behardien, this
banged in short and on off stump, Behardien swivels and pulls to deep square leg. Was a little late on the shot that time.

howzzat, they ask and de Kock walks as he nicks and upper cut to the keeper. The umpire wasn't willing to give him out, but eventually has to. It was the glove, reveals snicko as the short ball was slid across him. South Africa lose a vital wicket. End of one of those innings de Kock might look back and say, "this was a turning point"
goes over the top with a bouncer and the ump calls it a wide
back of a length and sliding across the batsman, Parnell is happy to leave it
looks for that yorker straight away, but doesn't find the mark. Behardien pushes to mid-on and sneaks a single
back of a length on middle and leg, tucked away to midwicket
full and outside off, brings down an open face and slices it to deep third man
good length ball on off stump, pushed to short cover
went short again and Behardien goes boom through midwicket. Looked like a flat-batted swipe as much as it was a pull. Pure power
seeks the yorker on off stump, but ends up a bit of a low full toss that is pushed down to mid-off
that's a short ball that forces him off his feet to blunt it towards square leg
punched away to point as this was short and outside off
top shot! He has waited on the short ball to come on and then helps it away to the fine leg boundary with a pull, rolled his wrists on top of it and timed it very sweetly
the slower short ball this time, Behardien has spotted it early and chops it to deep third man
full on off stump, pushed back at mid-on
short and wide, Parnell taps it in front of point for a single
fuller and a shade outside off, pushed to the left of short cover and to the right of mid-off for a single
uses the angle into him and flicks a poor delivery to the fine leg boundary. Too acute an angle and whatever length it was - this one was fuller - wouldn't have bothered the batsman
back of a length on off stump, worked to midwicket
144 kph, looks for the wide yorker but Behardien is able to slice it away behind point, only just though as Smith leaps to his left with one hand extending as far as it could
125kph, full on off stump, Behardien pushes to mid-on
full and angled in on middle at 141 kph, pushed to mid-on
back of a length and on off stump, tapped away in front of point with soft hands. Well run
picks up a ball that really wasn't all that short and has deposited it to the midwicket boundary. His pull shot is working big time today, took it almost off the front foot this time
fuller delivery pushed to the left of mid-off even if he was playing from the crease.
back of a length on off stump, worked down towards mid-on and Parnell practices a flick through midwicket after the fact
slower ball fools Parnell as he looks to flay it through the covers and misses
short on off stump and it's Parnell's turn to pull off the front foot. Doesn't quite time it and mid-on is able get behind it

shot, but he can't pierce the field on the off side. The search for the yorker goes off by a couple of inches and Parnell has nailed a drive to the right of mid-off, but Faulkner moves swiftly and dives. Misfields, but he did save two
back of a length and on middle and leg, he works it down towards fine leg

length on off stump and Behardien has lifted it over mid-off. Might not have timed it as well has he has been doing this innings, but he's finding the boundaries South Africa so desperately need right now
speared into the blockhole down leg, Behardien misses a flick and gets hit on the pads
full toss outside off, Behardien guides it away to deep cover
full and tailing down, Parnell has whipped it away to the left of deep square leg. Far enough that despite it being Warner, they pick up a couple

another sumptuously timed stroke from Behardien. What has been been doing today? This was a bit too full on off stump and he smacks it back at the bowler. Hazlewood does quite well to get down on his followthrough
back of a length and outside off, Behardien looks to force it through the off side and is beaten
thumped away through extra cover, and there's the boundary his team wants. Similar delivery to the last one, but it didn't have as much bounce and his back-foot play today has been near flawless
tucked away to the right of square leg
nails the wide yorker and Parnell was too slow in bring down his chop to point

belted down the ground! Parnell joins in the flurry, and is helped out by the bowler missing his wide yorker. The half-volley has been hit hard enough that Steven Smith at long-on becomes a spectator as well. South Africa have their 250 up
stays beside the shortish ball on middle and punches to deep cover
shortish on off stump, run down towards point
runs down the track and gets an inside edge off the swipe and it goes to long-on. Parnell spots an opportunity for a double and hares across
there's the short bounder as the slower ball sits up for Behardien, but this time his placement if wrong. Throws his head back as he finds square leg dead on
another slower ball, fuller on middle and leg. Parnell had to check his shot after looking to flick too early. Single towards midwicket
length and outside off, slapped away to deep cover and they pick up a couple and Behardien stretches on the outfield to ward off his hip troubles
a little too much on the wide yorker and the full toss takes the inside half of the bat to mid-on. Single is the result

goes short on off stump, Behardien pulls to deep square leg and the long boundary down there affords the batsman three runs. This has been one amazing little partnership, and quietly Behardien has moved onto fifty, off 35 balls
goes for the big inswinging yorker, gets the inswing part right but it's a low full toss which is heaved away to deep square leg
What. A. Shot! AB would struggle to match that as he backs away and lifts a length ball cramping him for room and lift it nonchalantly over extra cover. Very classy!
backs away again and slashes a shortish delivery angled sharply at him and gets a single to deep third man
full and wide of off stump, sliced away to cover for a single
heeeeeave, and it clatters into the crowd behind midwicket. Slower ball first up and Behardien went deep in the crease and clobbered it

goes for the same shot as he moved back and across on off stump, misses his shot and seems to be struck in line. At least the umpire thinks so. It's a proper delivery, Hot Spot says there is no nick. Billy Bowden wants the snicko, no spike there either. Eagle Eye though says it is pitching outside leg and Behardien has pulled off a good review.
short and wide outside off, he goes for a great big slash over point and misses

length and Behardien goes for the hoick again! He had nailed it, but Steven Smith skirts the rope and picks up a lovely catch to his left and over his shoulders. Top innings, this. The kind that will decide a match
fullish on middle and he presents the perfect front foot block.
slower ball off the back of the hand, McLaren slogs and gets a bottom edge down to the keeper. Single taken

inn2.comm: looks to sneak a single towards midwicket, highly optimistic that with the fielder swooping in on the ball. Finch has to hurry back
that's his USP, the extra bounce at his pace. Kicks up off back of a length and doesn't allow Warner the time he thought he had for a one-legged pull. Inside edge lobs off the pad towards point
short and helped up and over the midwicket field. More of a scoop in front of the wicket, that shot.

shot! The innings is only four balls old, but it would take a lot to one-up that glorious cover drive. Just a little too full from Morkel and he leans into it, hits the gap to the left of mid-off and just watches it sail away
back of a length and ducks back in at Finch, who leaves quite well because it was just about outside off
this one straightens off a good length and Finch is able to adjust to it with an open blade and sneak a single into the covers
back of a length on middle and leg, Finch had wanted to tick it through midwicket but a bit of late shape away takes the leading edge and then lobs up at the body
sublime! Another poor delivery, and this one had width in addition to being a half-volley. Finch got forward and across caressed it away through covers
back of a length on off stump, defended
slips a length ball down leg and Finch can't tickle it as he wants to. Doesn't matter though, it's a wide
shortish and doesn't quite rise up, Finch bunts it right through short cover for a quick single
the off-side is being peppered! Full and wide to the left-hander now and Warner throws his bat at it and slices it in the gap between point and cover
back of a length and outside off, pushed into the covers
back of a length on off stump, Finch stands up tall and punches into the off side. Faf dives at short cover and takes care of it
run down to third man as he presents an open face against a shortish ball only a shade outside off
fullish on middle and leg, Warner prefers to stay back and push to mid-on
clobbered! It was length and Warner decides it just has to go and smashes it to the boundary at cow corner. Very emphatic
fuller ball pushed across the left-hander and he chooses to let it go at the very last moment
Crowd catch alert! This was just back of a length on leg stump and he has helped it away a la Sanath Jayasuriya over square leg. So clean
shortish and outside off, Finch slices it to third man
back of a length and on off stump, defended into the covers
waits on a shortish ball outside off and chops it to point
leans forward and drills a fuller ball outside off through to cover
good length ball on middle, kept out
opens the face as he keeps to his back foot and pushes a shortish ball into cover
good start, and he shows off a bit of aggression by feigning to throw after fielding a push down the ground off the back foot. Finch barely flinches
gets across on off stump and flicks a shortish ball through midwicket

fuller delivery on middle and leg, Warner looks to lift it over the leg-side infield again but he hasn't timed it well. There's a deep square leg, there's mid-on chasing after it as well. But it falls between them
bowls short on middle and leg and Warner has pulled it behind square where there is no protection. It was always these two that were the biggest threat to South Africa

and one of 'em's gone! What a catch from Peterson at mid-on! It was swirling, he had to run to his left, then has to move back and then dive even further to pluck a smashing catch over his shoulder! It wasn't quite the best length to come forward and go for that lift over the leg side. Hits a little too high on the bat and he lost control of it, judging by how his bottom hand came off it
fuller delivery on middle and leg, pushed down to mid-on
good length ball that cuts back in at Watson who had plonked his front foot across to block. Huge appeal from Abbott, but it might be a touch too high and moving a bit too much
pushes forward on off stump and defends back at the bowler. Big stride again, but he didn't get it that far across
good length ball outside off, Watson blocks
gets forward to push a good length ball down to mid-on. Abbott's doing well to pull things back here
got across on off stump and whips a fuller delivery past a diving mid-on. That was the plan from South Africa, to get him out leg before but that time the timing was too good
fuller delivery on and around off stump, Watson leans forward and taps it down the ground. Seemed to almost check his stroke as he realised he was onto it too early. But again the ball runs away
back of a length on off stump, jumps back to block
short and on middle and leg, not the best line with your fine leg up inside the circle. Finch shuffles across and pulls it past that man and collects a simple boundary
fuller on middle and off, Finch unleashes the full face of the bat and finds mid-on
tucks a good length ball through midwicket and picks up a couple before deep square leg can run across
short and wide and the ball screams please hit me. Finch obliges and beats a desperately diving David Miller at point
back of a length on off stump, defended down the pitch.
back of a length and a shade outside off, Watson watches it go through to the keeper and was a touch surprised by the bounce on it
good length ball on off stump, defended as he gets forward to it
beaut from Morkel as he hits back of a length and lures some extra bounce to beat the prodding bat of Watson
back of a length and outside off, Watson learns from the previous mistake and shoulders arms
shortish on off stump, defended
rises on Watson again just outside off, but he was able to ride it away to third man rather well.
starts off with a poor delivery down leg. Watson isn't able to connect with a flick
stays back and punches a shortish delivery outside off to short cover. Good work from Faf again
clipped away as McLaren strays too straight again. Deep square leg mops up
back of a length and outside off, Finch is caught in his crease as he defends and gets an outside edge towards point
full and wide outside off, Finch looks to launch it over point and gets it right off the bottom of the bat. Three fielders race after it, but it has carried too far
good length ball that is angled in at middle and off. Watson plants his front foot on off stump and has to play around his pad. Manages an inside edge behind square leg
short and wide outside off, Finch chops it straight at point
overpitched outside off and Watson has pummeled it straight down the ground. Just an extension of defence, and his power takes care of the rest
reverts back to his shortish length outside off and keeps Watson quiet.
good length ball on off stump, Watson taps and runs into the leg side before Morkel can cut across
shortish and outside off, pushed towards mid-off
blocks a back of a length delivery outside off with soft hands possibly hoping for a single, not there
dug in short and Finch has lifted his front leg off the pitch and pulled it in front of square. Didn't bother about keeping the ball down, and he doesn't need to if he picked the gap like that
shortish and outside off and it doens't bounce as much as Watson thought. The slash happens well above the ball and it bounces before reaching the keeper
this time he manages to slap a short ball from outside off to deep point
squares him up with a fuller delivery on off stump, Finch should have come forward to that but because he stayed back he gets an outside edge to point
top shot! He has already hit one of those, in the first over, I think, and gets another opportunity. Fuller delivery outside off and it's been caressed past mid-off's left
sliding down leg and Finch can't connect with a flick because the ball stays a touch slow. Kisses the pad and down to the keeper
looks for another off drive, but McLaren has pulled his length back and slowed down his pace. Inside edge wanders away toward midwicket
flighted on middle as Watson shimmies down and drives past Peterson diving to his right
tossed up on leg stump, Finch stays inside the line to try and drive through mid-off again but gets an inside edge down to long-on
another little trek down the pitch by Watson as he flicks a good length ball to long-on
tossed up on middle, Finch stays leg side of it and drives at short cover
that was so close to being bowled! It was the slider from Peterson and he might well have liked Finch setting up for the cut shot as he backed away, but the middle of the bat comes down on the ball
flighted on middle and leg, driven to long-off
fuller delivery outside off as Finch nails another drive and Rossouw misfields at cover to present a single
sliding down leg and Watson has flicked it to fine leg off the front foot
that seems to be the slower ball on off stump, Finch shuffles across and clips through midwicket
fuller and wide of off stump, Watson looks to flay it through the covers but gets the inside edge
good length ball brings Watson forward as he drives to mid-off
straying down leg again and Watson helps it away to fine leg. McLaren needs to get better consistency with his lines if South Africa want to build pressure today. He'll be key late in the innings
a little nip down to the pitch of a flighted ball and whip it to long-on
flighted on leg stump as Finch gets forward and block. Ends up smothered the ball off the inside edge onto pad and it evades off stump by a couple of inches
this is a half-volley on middle, Finch backs away and flays it through the covers. That's been his shot today, he has favoured the off side with a certain obsession

backs away and lifts him over cover! Peterson's flight only helps out the batsman as he presses forward and launches him away. That's Finch's fifty, and it's come about with a stroke that has served him well all night.
pulls his length back and bowls flatter on leg stump, defended
backs away and punches a flatter delivery to short cover
good length ball on middle, Watson clips it to deep square leg
there seems to be some late inswing on this full delivery, Finch sets up for a drive and ensures he plays late enough and with a straight bat to help himself
full and a shade outside off, Finch drives to mid-off
back of a length and outside off, Finch blocks and looks for a single. Sent back by Watson, and rightly
beautiful! People might think this is a highlights package! South Africa keep bowling full and outside off and Finch keeps belting them through extra cover. Replay after replay after replay
good length ball outside off as Finch gets forward to block. And oopsy, the bowler's overstepped. Finch has a smile as he realises it is free hit time
lobs up a full toss outside off, Finch plants his back leg across and swipes it away to the midwicket boundary. Talk about a free hit!
good length ball on off stump, defended solidly off the front foot
that came off the back of the hand as Watson leans into a drive to long-off
shortish and outside off, sliced away to cover point
another slower ball, this one on a length as Finch drives to long-off
fuller delivery outside off, Watson pushes back at the bowler
brings Watson forward with a fullish ball and makes him block
back of a length and cramping him for room on middle and leg, Finch jumps in his crease as he looks to flick and doesn't quite connect. That's about the length and line to frustrate him
width on offer as he stands up tall behind a shortish ball and punches to short cover
another no-ball foils a pretty decent delivery outside off. It was slower and not quite short enough for the pull as the ball sneaks below the bat
free hit has been bunted down to mid-on as Abbott nails a yorker just outside off. Finch was batting on off stump that time, like he was set up deep in his crease off the last free hit
banged in short to refuse Watson the liberty of that big front foot stride. Good direction too as it was on middle and leg. Watson sways away well
opens the face on this good length ball and runs it down to third man
back of a length and outside off, blocked
good length ball on middle and off, tucked away to short midwicket. Leg cutter again
fuller delivery outside off, defended
good length ball on off stump, pushed away into the gap to the left of cover
stands up tall behind a shortish ball and swats it down to long-on
goes back to a length ball and clips it to short midwicket
this seems to get a little more bounce than Watson anticipated, and the flick he was going for drops by his feet
there's protection in the deep, so the short ball on middle yields only a single despite the pull being hit right off the middle
another short ball and Watson has hammered a pull to deep midwicket
shortish and outside off, Finch lifts it over point
another short ball, but this is the slower one to thwart a pull. Finch pulls a bit too early and gets an inside edge through midwicket
fuller delivery on off stump, defended
back of a length and a shade outside off, Watson pushes to mid-off with short cover diving across as well
it's a full toss outside off and Finch has laced it through the covers. Morne Morkel is the sweeper and has to rush to his right, dives but is still unable to stop it
pushed through the covers again as this is a good length ball outside off
fuller and wide outside off, driven to long-off

overpitched again and Finch has slapped it through the covers. This time Morkel is able to hustle to his right a little bitter. Had a shorter distance to cover as well, I think and is asked to come up the field. Can't have your strike bowler expending too much energy like that
full on middle, Finch drives to long-on. Can't go wrong on the drive, that's his motto today
good length ball on off stump, Watson was looking for mid-off but had played outside the line so finds Behardien instead
shortish on middle and leg, tucked to the right of midwicket
back of a length on off stump, blocked to short cover

drags the ball short and Watson is all over it. Swivels on his back foot and unleashes the lot of his power. What did that ball ever do to him? Pulled off the front foot, even as he only needed to shift his balance back
fuller delivery on middle, defended

length ball on off stump and he had hit it soft enough for a quick single. Only both batsmen were set on a collision course. Good thing Behardien misfielded, otherwise there was a run out change at the bowlers'
shortish and outside off, chopped down to deep point
rocks back and pulls a length ball down to long-on
holds up on the pitch as Watson comes forward to block
goes back and flicks a length ball through to deep midwicket to bring up the hundred partnership
flighted on middle and off, defended

tossed up on off stump as Finch lifts it. He's struck this really welll, which is why it carries as far as Faf on the edge of the extra cover boundary. Takes it with a reverse cup, but his momentum was taking him back, so he throws it to team-mate Rossouw who completes the catch. Needed a bit of brilliance like that to dislodge Finch
goes back to punch a length delivery to short cover, where Miller is positioned
good length ball pushed across Smith, who doesn't bother with it
gets across outside off and clips a length ball to deep midwicket
good length ball on off stump, defended towards point
fullish delivery on off stump, defended to short cover
punched down to mid-on as Parnell seeks some inswing off a fuller length

full and wide, Watson has nailed it through extra cover. Full swing of the bat, which ends up behind his back on the followthrough. South Africa have offered this very same ball a little too often, and have been hurt equally often
shortish on off stump, defended
gets across on off stump and tucks a shortish delivery to the right of midwicket
goes short and outside off, Watson looks for a pull but is a bit late on it. Deflects off his front leg that was up off the ground and towards fine leg
shortish on off stump, pushed down to mid-on for a quick single
shortish and outside off, punched in front of point
nudged behind square leg and they pick up a single. No chance of more because Watson and Morkel had bumped into each other
full and outside off, checks his tap into the covers
shortish and outside off, blocked towards point
can't quite get the flick going as this is a touch fuller on off stump. Defended though
slanted across the right-hander, might seem like an innocuous delivery that but it's quite dangerous for a right-hander. Beaten
gets across outside off and pushes away from his body, takes the outside edge down to third man
full and on the pads, whipped to short midwicket
top delivery! That's a Morkel special as he gets a back of a length delivery to lift alarmingly past the poking outside edge of the batsman. Just a bit of a straightening there
presses forward at a good length ball on off stump and blocks
gets down the track and whips a fuller ball through to deep midwicket
shortish and outside off, Watson chops it off the inside edge past the keeper's right
shortish and outside off, punched towards point
opens the face and tries to run a shortish delivery past point. Doesn't quite succeed as Miller dives to his left
shortish on off stump, quite zippy too. Watson has to go back and block and the ball thuds into the splice of his bat
steered away behind point as this was a back of a length delivery angled across him
banged in short, but Smith rocks back and pulls it down towards the deep backward square leg boundary. Morkel has a lot of work to do again, slides and keeps the ball in play and saves a boundary
jumps across to tickle a length ball down to fine leg and Morkel huffs and puffs to it again
shortish and outside off, Smith pushes it into the covers
fuller delivery on off stump, defended
runs down the track and wallops the length ball down the ground. Behardien at long-on chases after it and pulls out the big dive to keep it to two
nips down the track and whips a length ball to the left of short midwicket
a couple of steps down the track to whip a flighted delivery through deep midwicket The throw comes in as a direct hit and the ricochet gives away an extra run
good length ball sliding on, defended quite late
tossed up and a shade outside off, flicked it down to long-on
runs down the track, takes the flighted ball on the full and works it to long-on with a roll of his wrists

short and wide, Watson chopped it past the left of a flying Miller at point and his timing is good enough that neither third man or the sweeper had a chance. That's his fifty. Been quite a while since his last one
goes short and slides down leg, looks to pull but can't connect
back of a length and outside off, punched in front of point
he has no qualms jumping outside off and flicking a length ball, that might have been pushed to extra cover, away through square leg
back of a length delivery outside off, Smith inches forward to block with soft hands in search for a quick single. Watson isn't quite interested
full on off stump, pushed to mid-on
good length ball outside off, blocked, and that might be drinks
legcutter outside off, pushed past a diving the extra cover
looks for the blockhole and just about finds it as Smith pushes it back at the bowler
full on off stump, clipped away smartly through midwicket
good length ball on middle makes Watson close the face early. Gets a leading edge but it doesn't carry to the bowler
worked away through midwicket as he waited a bit more for this one
got a finger to it! It was Miller diving away to his right at short cover, but the ball evades him. An almost careless drive from Watson, really should have kept it down better
belted down the ground and that would have been four, but McLaren gets his boot in the way and flashes a big smile at Watson
shortish on off stump, pushed to short midwicket
good length ball brings Watson forward and the push to point is soft enough that they can sneak a quick single. It's Miller, who is unable to get the ball in his hands cleanly
charges down to the wrong delivery. It was angled and nipping back in to leave him short for room. Goes for a lazy waft and is beaten
reaches out for a shortish ball outside off and is left groping. Shakes his head as he studies the pitch
good length ball, kept out
slower ball on middle, Watson had almost planted his front leg across and looked primed for that leg before. But his bat comes down just in time
tucked away to midwicket, McLaren's the man diving to his left. South Africa haven't given up yet
fuller delivery brings him forward and punches it down the ground to long-off
length ball outside off, Smith slices it towards point where Hash keeps it to nothing by diving to his left
full and wide outside off, Smith is lured into a lazy drive and the ball wanders away in the air to an imaginary mid-off
another slower ball on off stump, pushed back at the bowler
length ball outside off, Smith looks to belt it through the off side but has played outside the line of it a touch. Mistimes it at short cover
shortish and angled in at Smith, tucks it away to deep fine leg
runs down the track and laces a shortish delivery through the gap in the covers. Not much of it was on offer, but he has angled the bat just enough to beat the man close in and the one deeper
fullish and outside off, Watson looks to drill it down the ground but a little shape in gets the inside edge
good length ball on middle and off, defended

dragged on! The Powerplay does the trick! It was shortish, but didn't quite have the room for the cut. The inside edge clangs into the stumps, but the umpires are asking for a front-foot check. And it's a huuuge no-ball. So Smith comes back to take strike against a free hit. Shot at his own leg there
nails the wide yorker and Smith has sliced it behind point. Abbott kicks the turf at the bowler crease
fuller delivery on off stump, defended
length ball on off stump, Smith heaves it away to deep midwicket. Nowhere near well-timed though
shortish and outside off, Watson cuts it to point
goes short, and it's quick enough to foil Watson's hook. Well done, Abbott
back of a length on middle, turns it to midwicket
Smith has not sized up the pace of this pitch at all. Goes for a poor slog off a length ball, and he's gone at it way too early. Toe-ends it into the off side
full on middle and with Smith shuffling across like that, it's a pretty good ploy for a leg-before decision. This time though there is an inside edge
full and on the pads, Watson has clipped it away to deep midwicket. Powerfully hit
full on off stump, Smith digs it out to mid-off
oh, hello! He's found the gap at fine leg to a ball that was full and quite a bit outside off. Loads of wristwork, and a bit of class as well
length and outside off, Smith plays an awful slog and gets an inside edge to square leg. Why does he resort to those shots when he'd just played a blinder the last ball?
fuller delivery a shade outside off and Watson brings down a straight face and beats mid-off comfortably. That's his shot and he nails it more often than not
that's the long boundary, but he has struck is powerfully enough to get a one-bounce four to midwicket. Read the bowler would go short after a fuller delivery the last ball
nails a yorker just a shade outside off and Watson just about digs it out
full and tailing in, Watson whips it away past short midwicket and there's a readymade two down there
full on the legs, Watson helps it away to deep square leg and another two to deep square leg
banged in short and Watson is happy to duck under it
length and Smith has nailed it! Stays deep in his crease, winds up with a giant backlift and lets it flow through the line of the ball. Slog works this time

back of a length on middle, Smith swings away towards midwicket and misses. de Kock thinks there might have been an edge, but not quite. Was a noise though... and Hot Spot reveals a thick edge! Second life for Smith
gets across outside off and tucks it through midwicket
in the slot again and Watson has lifted it straight over the bowler's head. Only the crowd needs to worry about that, if there were any behind the sightscreen....
back of a length and outside off, Watson pushes an angled face to try and run it down to third man. The ball straightens and beats him

caught at deep midwicket! It was just back of a length but Watson want forward anyway and hits it off the bottom of the bat. Checks it as he walks off the field. Finally South Africa have a breakthrough

slices a good length ball to third man. Seemed an outside edge more than anything and Morkel had it under cover as he jogged around to it, and then lets it slip between his fingers. South Africa continue being sloppy and Smith continues benefiting from it
banged in short and it's been pulled through midwicket

another thick outside edge as Smith stays beside the ball and tries to guide it fine. Morkel does the best he can do as he runs around and slides to push the ball back, but his boot had touched the rope as he was flicking the ball back
back of a length and on off stump, defended towards point for a quick single
full on off stump, defended from the crease
back of a length and outside off, Maxi blocks to short cover
good length ball on middle keeps Smith to a tentative block. Think he decided not to play a flick at the last moment
brings down a straight face on the shortish delivery outside off and gets it through the man at point. Miller misses out as he gets a bad bounce off the square
pushes his hands at a good length ball outside off, beaten
width on offer and Maxi lifts it over point, more off the outside edge

good length ball outside off, Smith taps into the covers and runs. A risky run as Miller gets a good bounce and looks to nail the target at the bowlers' end. Misses as Smith stretches as far forward as he could, testing his hamstring. Might well be another life, had that hit
slapped to point as this is short and wide

helpful half-volley outside off and Smith smashes it back down to long-off. Shakes his head and lifts his bat almost as he he has hated playing the way he has today with all the chances he's given and the many mistimed swipes, not to mention that hamstring. Still third fifty-plus score on the trot
picked away off middle and off and picks up a single to deep square leg
fuller delivery outside off, crisply hit through the covers
eases a good-looking drive to the left of point, but Miller does well
back of a length on off stump, defended
good length ball, only a shade outside off. Smith plays outside the line as he looks to steer towards point. Ends up going to cover
fuller delivery on leg stump, Maxi chips it over the vacant midwicket region for a couple before mid-on could catch up with it
whipped away through square leg as this is full on middle and leg
length ball outside off, sliced away off the open face to third man
gets down the track, while making enough room to lift a length ball over extra cover. Didn't quite time it, although he did try to belt the leather off it. Hobbles across for a couple
worked away through to the right of mid-on
runs down and has hit it right off the toe end! A typical Maxi dismissal as he tries to make too much out of a good ball, just back of a length. Behardien is at mid-off and completes a good catch.
shortish and outside off, Bailey is happy to leave it through to the keeper
fuller delivery on off stump, Bailey steers it away to third man
shortish and outside off, Smith blocks to point

short and wide, Smith has timed this wonderfully well. He hits the ball quite well when he's playing a good cricketing shot, it's only when he starts slogging that he loses his balance. This time he's placed the emphasis on placement and gets it behind point.
"wait," he says as he nails another steer. But this time it goes to point
attempts to be a little too cute as he walks across to a fuller delivery outside off and looks to work it away on the leg side. Gets a leading edge towards point instead.
back of a length and outside off, Bailey nudges it in front of point with soft hands and races away
banged in short and slips away too far outside off. Smith looks to cut, but can't reach it
fullish and outside off, defended
short ball and slogs it away to the midwicket boundary. Not pretty, not even off the middle of the bat, but very effective.
fuller delivery outside off, pushed from the crease and through the covers

short and wide of off stump, Bailey chops it towards point and sets off. There isn't a run there and he realises it too late. Miller gets a lovely bounce too, but misses his target again! Morkel's shoulders slump
fullish on off stump, Smith steers it to third man
tossed up on leg stump and Smith is down the track to flick the ball through to deep square leg. Terrific work to snare a couple there and Miller does well backing up behind the bowler
pushed down to long-on as he dances down to the pitch of the flighted ball outside off
this is the slider on middle and leg, pushed down towards mid-on off the back foot
gets down to sneak a single toward square leg. Not enough flight for Bailey to get under

beautiful shot, although some of the sheen comes off it as Rossouw takes a spectacular catch. He had reached the pitch and ensured he was beside the ball and set up in a way that he might well have straight driven it over the covers. But the problem was he had hit it in the air and Rossouw runs in from deep cover and picks up a lovely, low catch while sliding forward
outside edge! But it falls short of slip. This was tossed up and Wade stepped forward tentatively to defend outside his off stump. Amla does well in the end to stop the ball

and has picked up a wicket. Gee, someone began counting their chickens too early. This was not quite short enough to pull, but that is what Bailey does. The bat face turns in his hands and the ball goes straight up to be caught by Rossouw again, this time at mid-on
back of a length and slid across the left-hander who is beaten all ends up! A lot more bounce than Wade originally thought, and just a bit of nip away too. Is this game still on?
steers a good length ball off the open face past the lone slip, who gets just enough of a hand on it that there is time for a couple
shuffles across and cramps himself for room as he goes for a back-foot slash through cover point. Beaten again

back of a length and outside off, Wade set off, Faulkner wasn't interested and then has to get the skates on. Miller is at point again and again he misses! Poor fellow, this was his third time he missed a direct hit that could have changed the game
gets an inside edge off a good length ball on off stump as Faulkner is stuck at the crease. Someone tell Australia they only have eight runs to win

bowled 'im! And we thought only South Africa can choke! What a delivery, he had enticed the batsman to dance down the track, hits the rough and turns right through the gap between bat and pad and hits middle. A dream dismissal for a left-arm spinner
tossed up outside off as Cummins pushes forward to drive through the off side. Slider comes on with the arm and takes the inside edge
good length ball driven in the region of short cover who dives to his right and pulls it back
quicker and flatter on middle, Cummins pushes to short cover and Miller is behind it gone
two in the over! Robbie P is on fire! Another slider, way too quick for Cummins who is stuck in his crease and pushes tamely. Off stump pegged back. Sydney goes quiet, South Africa roar!
fullish on off stump, Starc pushes towards mid-on, but Miller runs across from short midwicket to grab it. Double-wicket maiden!
fuller delivery outside off, Faulkner pushes to short cover
good length ball on off stump, pushed to mid-off and they scamper a single. Seven off 10 now
flash and miss outside off! Simple seam-up delivery angled across him and the pressure means he is rooted in his crease
good length ball pushed to mid-off. Another dot ball. That equation is headed towards a run-a-ball in the last over

good length ball outside off, and Abbott has overstepped! Starc sneaks a single into the covers. He overstepped when he had Smith bowled as well, and now he will have to bowl a free-hit delivery at James Faulkner
looks for a wide yorker, doesn't quite get it as Faulkner slashes to deep cover
full on off stump, Starc squeezes it out to cover

swept away and that's the win! Faulkner has his hands up in the air and swings his bat down in disdain! It was length and outside off, perfect for that cross-batted swipe and he nailed it. Australia become the No.1-ranked ODI team again, but they'd want to forget this last half-hour's play
